_comment: Copy-paste MCP configurations for connecting to the Elementor MCP server. Pick the one that matches your client and environment.

claude_desktop_local_wpcli._description: Claude Desktop — local WordPress via WP-CLI (fastest, recommended for local dev)

claude_desktop_remote_proxy._description: Claude Desktop — remote WordPress via Node.js HTTP proxy (absolute path required for Desktop)

env.WP_APP_PASSWORD: xxxx xxxx xxxx xxxx xxxx xxxx

claude_code_mcp_json._description: Claude Code — place as .mcp.json in project root

vscode_mcp_direct_http._description: VS Code MCP extension — direct HTTP connection (add to VS Code settings)

mcp_inspector_wpcli._description: MCP Inspector — test and debug tools via WP-CLI

mcp_inspector_proxy._description: MCP Inspector — test and debug tools via HTTP proxy
mcp_inspector_proxy._command: npx @modelcontextprotocol/inspector -e WP_URL=https://your-site.com -e WP_USERNAME=admin -e WP_APP_PASSWORD=xxxx node bin/mcp-proxy.mjs
